pull.title: [qa] Send segwit-encoded blocktxn messages in p2p-compactblocks
pull.body: Test with segwit blocktxn messages, since that was missed in #8904, in accordance with the updates to the BIP at https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/462.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Bitcoin (dont fork from here, fork from bitcoin/bitcoin)

events.message: [qa] Send segwit-encoded blocktxn messages in p2p-compactblocks

events.body:
utACK, good catch on the missing test case.

If you add an additional commit that sets `block.nVersion=4` in the `build_block_on_tip()` function, then I believe this would address the outstanding issue in #8916: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8916#discussion_r83298887

Hmm, wasn't targeting this for backport, though I suppose it doesn't really matter... I'll add that commit.

On October 14, 2016 8:00:43 PM EDT, Suhas Daftuar notifications@github.com wrote:

> utACK, good catch on the missing test case.
> 
> If you add an additional commit that sets `block.nVersion=4` in the
> `build_block_on_tip()` function, then I believe this would address the
> outstanding issue in #8916:
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8916#discussion_r83298887
> 
> ## 
> 
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8922#issuecomment-253946959

events.message:
[qa] Build v4 blocks in p2p-compactblocktests

This fixes an issue in backporting to 0.13 as 0.13 enforces SF
activation by block version lockin instead of through a hard-coded
block height.

events.body: @sdaftuar ok, that should do it, I believe...I suppose this should get a "Needs Backport" tag now.
